content:
æˆ‘å¸Œæœ›ç”¨antigravityåŸç”Ÿåªæ”¯æŒï¼Œ[Pasted ~1"Antigravity e2e" refers to the capability of Google Antigravity, an AI-powered integrated development environment (IDE), to manage and execute end-to-end (e2e) software development tasks autonomously using AI agents. 
Google Antigravity and E2E Capabilities
Google Antigravity, announced in November 2025 and powered by the Gemini 3 models, is designed around "agentic development." It allows AI agents to handle entire workflows, from planning to testing. 
End-to-end capabilities include:
Autonomous planning: Agents analyze requirements, break down tasks, and create implementation plans without human input.
Code generation and editing: The AI can write and modify code across multiple files.
Terminal execution: Agents can run terminal commands, such as installing packages or performing Git operations.
Browser automation and UI testing: The "Browser Sub-agent" allows the AI to launch a local development server, open a built-in browser, interact with the UI (click, scroll, type), and perform self-validation and verification.
Bug fixing: Agents can automatically identify and fix bugs during testing and development.
Artifact generation: The system generates artifacts like architectural diagrams, progress reports, screenshots, and code diffs for review. 
The "e2e" aspect means a developer can provide a high-level goal or task. Antigravity agents can then handle the software development lifecycle for that task within a single, integrated environment, minimizing the need for human intervention. 
For more information, explore the Google Antigravity Documentation or watch end-to-end workflow examples on YouTube.
